Description: Glazed composition amulets of the Sons of Horus: mould-made set of the Four Sons of Horus, with details of the tripartite wigs, broad collars, and plinths painted in blue and black. Three sets of threadholes—at head, mid-section, and feet—appear on the back of each amulet, allowing them to be invisibly sewn to the mummy bandages.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. Seipel, 'Ägypten' Vol. 1 (Linz, 1989), p.187 [153a-d]; C. Andrews, 'Egyptian Mummies' (London/Cambridge MA, 1984), p. 39, fig. 39.
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p275)
Friedman 1998 / Gifts of the Nile: Ancient Egyptian Faience (157)
